info.author: unweb.me
info.description:
Introduction
============

unweb.watermark lets you protect your high resolution images while publishing 
resized and watermarked versions. The original images will only be available 
to users with the "Licensee" role.

Add it to your instance eggs in buildout and install using the Plone Add-ons 
panel. 

Go to the "Watermark settings" configuration panel and set a watermark image.

Then upload your hi-res images normally. The default Plone workflow will be 
applied. Whenever you publish an image, the original file will be transfered to
a protected image field and the watermarked and resize image will be displayed
in the default image field. If you retract the image then the original file
will replace the watermarked one.

Can be used standalone or in combination with `unweb.iptc`_

.. _unweb.iptc: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/unweb.iptc

Created by `unweb.me`_

.. _unweb.me: https://unweb.me
 

Changelog
=========

0.3 (2010-11-22)
----------------

- Remove empty locales folder which was causing problems in some buildouts

0.2 (2010-11-19)
----------------

- Added missing versions.cfg file

0.1 (2010-11-13)
----------------

- Initial release
info.name: unweb.watermark
info.summary: Support for adding watermarks to images

Introduction

Add it to your instance eggs in buildout and install using the Plone Add-ons panel.

Then upload your hi-res images normally. The default Plone workflow will be applied. Whenever you publish an image, the original file will be transfered to a protected image field and the watermarked and resize image will be displayed in the default image field. If you retract the image then the original file will replace the watermarked one.

Can be used standalone or in combination with unweb.iptc

Created by unweb.me

Changelog

0.3 (2010-11-22)
